channel.title: VPS botting
channel.description: I have a vps that im not using, will I be able to bot on it?

item.title: VPS botting
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

IlikeArrays:

Your seeing runescape through another computer… of course there will be delay.

I know, i was…being stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS botting
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:12, topic:385135”][quote author=Rash link=topic=480898.msg3522024#msg3522024 date=1299464696]

I use my vps to run bots. Works pretty good and you can check them from anywhere (I have a remote desktop connection on my iphone.)

Im just wondering, whenever I try to run a client it lags so bad.
Wouldnt that happen with a bot?

Thats the thing. It looks like it is running really laggy but it isn’t. It is just taking a couple seconds to update the picture.

So its my connetion to the vps that is making it look lagy?

Yeah i’m pretty sure. Mine run fine but when I look at them they look laggy.

Could I grab your msn?
I have alot of question about this
[/quote]

Sure i’ll be on for a couple more mins. Marcbobishere@hotmail.com[/quote]

Cheers

Read full topic

item.title: VPS botting
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

ytuio9:

Actually yes, people do gain a lot from running bots on a VPS. just be careful when eventually transferring the money to your main as your mules/main could get banned.

ALright, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: VPS botting
item.dc:creator: @rash Rash
item.description:
@rash wrote:

Good question, why are you asking us? Nothing’s stopping you.

When you try to run a client, it fucks up, so yea.

Phaze One:

Absolutely, infact it’s recommended. You can run multiple bots at a time from a VPS

Thanks.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
